verses.roman:
anukūla-vāte yadi pāya mora gandha
uḍiyā paḍite cāhe, preme haya andha

synonyms: anukūla-vāte—in a favorable breeze; yadi—if; pāya—there is; mora—My; gandha—fragrance; uḍiyā—flying; paḍite—to drop; cāhe—She wants; preme—in ecstatic love; haya—becomes; andha—blind.
translation: "When a favorable breeze carries to Her the fragrance of My body, She is blinded by love and tries to fly into that breeze.
